benchmark_details.name: MM-Escape (Multimodal Escape)
benchmark_details.overview: MM-Escape is an extensible benchmark for evaluating complex multimodal reasoning abilities in MLLMs, based on real-world escape games. It emphasizes both the reasoning process and task completion.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance comprehensive evaluation of multimodal reasoning for MLLMs through quantitative assessment of intermediate reasoning processes and task completion performance.

data.source: Automatically generated 3D room environments from a procedural generation framework.
data.annotation: Automatically generated with 3D furniture models and gameplay logic.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on interactions and success rates during gameplay.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ER indicates better performance in escaping the room; also assesses intermediate steps and prop interactions.
methodology.baseline_results: Results show performance metrics across Difficulty-1, Difficulty-2, and Difficulty-3 scenarios.
methodology.validation: Evaluated through gameplay demonstrations and model interactions in the escape environment.
